page.title: 06THE NURSERY AT RISELEY (2)
page.content:
The flowers are grown in netting so that they grow straight up, one bloom to each square; the net is raised as the flower grows. Mr. Wilkinson uses a lot of fertiliser both in the soil and as liquid feeds.
Temperature is very important so the greenhouses are heated by coal burned in a huge boiler. Seven crops of each flower are grown every two years. Many colours of each flower are grown but white is the most popular. They are used in flower arrangements, bouquets and wreaths. Mr. Wilkinson sells to 49 shops within a 39 mile radius; the rest go to wholesale markets. On the whole Mr. Wilkinson enjoys his job.
